H0.text: Skin is the type of tissue that functions to move the bones.

H1.text: Blood is the type of tissue that functions to move the bones.

H2.text: Muscle is the type of tissue that functions to move the bones.

H3.text: Brain is the type of tissue that functions to move the bones.

A4.text: Skeletal muscle is voluntary muscle, anchored by tendons or sometimes by aponeuroses to bones, and is used to effect skeletal movement such as locomotion and to maintain posture.
